message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) and specifically focuses on the problem of polysemy modeling, which is a common problem in NLP. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a three-fold approach that involves sense induction and disambiguation, which are common tasks in machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also uses clustering algorithms and geometric representations, which are common in information retrieval (cs.IR) and computational geometry (cs.CG), making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) a possible sub-category as well.
